questions.text: What is weathering?
choices: The carrying away of soil by water
The breaking and changing of rocks and minerals by wind, ice, plants, animals, and chemical changes
The process of soil turning into bedrock
The decomposition of plant matter in soil
questions.correctAnswer: The breaking and changing of rocks and minerals by wind, ice, plants, animals, and chemical changes

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT an example of weathering?
choices: Sediment being carried away by a river
questions.correctAnswer: Sediment being carried away by a river

questions.text: What is erosion?
choices: The breaking down of rocks by chemical changes
The carrying away or moving of weathered material by wind or water
The process of soil formation from organic matter
The expansion of roots into rock crevices
questions.correctAnswer: The carrying away or moving of weathered material by wind or water

questions.text: How is soil formed?
choices: When water freezes and expands in rock crevices
When rocks and minerals are weathered and mix with decaying plants and animals
When bedrock rises to the surface
questions.correctAnswer: When rocks and minerals are weathered and mix with decaying plants and animals

questions.text: What are the three layers of soil in order from top to bottom?
Which soil layer provides support and nutrients necessary for plant growth?
Which soil layer is a mixture of rock and soil where only large tree roots grow?
What is the bottom layer of soil made up of?
choices: A mixture of rock and soil

questions.text: Which soil component holds the least amount of water?
Which soil component has the smallest particles and holds the most water?
What is sand made up of?
choices: Equal parts of sand, silt, and clay

questions.text: What is humus?
choices: Decayed matter in topsoil that adds nutrients
Hard, solid particles that provide no nutrients
questions.correctAnswer: Decayed matter in topsoil that adds nutrients

questions.text: What type of soil is considered the best soil for plant growth?
What is loam soil composed of?
choices: Equal parts of sand, silt, with a smaller amount of clay
questions.correctAnswer: Equal parts of sand, silt, with a smaller amount of clay

questions.text: How does soil affect plant life in an area?
choices: It has no effect on what plants can grow
It only affects the color of plants
It determines what types of plants can live in an area
It only affects how tall plants grow
questions.correctAnswer: It determines what types of plants can live in an area
